ground_truth: Spider-Man attaches two webs to buildings on either side of the track, but the web breaks, causing him to fall forward. As the train hurtles towards the river, Spider-Man fires webs at buildings, and a block of web shoots out. Spider-Man takes the strain, and although it rips his costume in several places, he uses the webs to restrain the train's forward thrust. His features are contorted as some of the webs start to break. The train approaches the buffers, crashes through them, and careens forward to the edge, with the first carriage teetering over. Spider-Man stands glued to the front, holding the webs attached to the buildings. The train grinds to a halt, and Spider-Man's eyes close as he releases the web and slumps forward. Hands prevent him from falling, and the passengers lift the unconscious, unmasked Spider-Man into the carriage. His head falls back as he's passed along over people's heads until he's gently lowered to the floor. His face visible, the passengers stare at him. As the kid's eyes open and his gloved hands touch his face, a worried look shows as he realizes he is without a mask. He sits up as a passenger crouches down, looks around, and two boys step forward. The younger one stretches out his hand with Spider-Man's mask, which Peter takes. Through tear-filled eyes, Peter gazes at the boys, then lowers his head, and slips on the mask to become Spider-Man again. He sits up straight, struggles to rise, and is helped to his feet by more hands that steady him. The door behind Spider-Man clatters in as Octavius climbs on board, facing him. A passenger steps forward, followed by others who step between Spider-Man and Octavius. Octavius simply smiles and sweeps them aside using two of his limbs, leaving a clear path to Spider-Man. Spider-Man gestures to those around him and staggers forward, but a punch from a mechanical limb sends him to the floor, where he lies helpless. Meanwhile, an electric storm hovers over the Osborn home, and inside, Harry drinks. He turns to see Octavius holding Spider-Man above his head. Harry points to the couch, where he had seen Spider-Man stand over his dead father, and Octavius lays the bound figure down.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Spider-Man fastens two strands to structures on each side of the path, but the strand snaps, causing him to topple forward. As the carriage speeds towards the waterway, Spider-Man launches strands at structures, and a mass of strand ejects out. Spider-Man withstands the tension, and although it tears his outfit in multiple spots, he utilizes the strands to constrain the carriage's onward drive. His features are twisted as some of the strands begin to snap. The carriage nears the stops, crashes through them, and hurtles forward to the brink, with the initial compartment wobbling over. Spider-Man stands adhered to the front, grasping the strands fastened to the structures. The carriage grinds to a stop, and Spider-Man's eyes shut as he releases the strand and lurches forward. Hands stop him from plummeting, and the riders lift the senseless, unmasked Spider-Man into the compartment. His head lolls back as he's passed along above people's heads until he's gently lowered to the ground. His visage discernible, the riders gaze at him. As the youth's eyes open and his gloved hands touch his visage, a concerned expression appears as he realizes he is maskless. He sits up as a rider crouches down, looks around, and two youths step forward. The younger one extends his hand with Spider-Man's mask, which Peter accepts. Through tear-filled eyes, Peter looks at the youths, then lowers his head, and slips on the mask to become Spider-Man again. He sits up erect, struggles to stand, and is aided to his feet by additional hands that steady him. The door behind Spider-Man clatters in as Octavius climbs aboard, confronting him. A rider steps forward, followed by others who step between Spider-Man and Octavius. Octavius merely grins and sweeps them aside using two of his limbs, leaving a clear route to Spider-Man. Spider-Man motions to those around him and staggers forward, but a strike from a mechanical limb sends him to the ground, where he lies powerless. Meanwhile, an electric tempest looms over the Osborn residence, and inside, Harry drinks. He turns to see Octavius holding Spider-Man above his head. Harry indicates the couch, where he had witnessed Spider-Man stand over his deceased father, and Octavius places the restrained figure down.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Two webs are attached to buildings on either side of the track by Spider-Man, but the web breaks, causing him to fall forward. As the train is hurtled towards the river, webs are fired by Spider-Man at buildings, and a block of web shoots out. The strain is taken by Spider-Man, and although his costume is ripped in several places, the train's forward thrust is restrained using the webs by him. His features contort as some of the webs start to break. The buffers are approached by the train, are crashed through by it, and it careens forward to the edge, with the first carriage teetering over. Glued to the front, Spider-Man stands, holding the webs attached to the buildings. The train is ground to a halt, and Spider-Man's eyes are closed by him as the web is released and he slumps forward. He is prevented from falling by hands, and the unconscious, unmasked Spider-Man is lifted into the carriage by the passengers. His head falls back as people pass him along over their heads until he is gently lowered to the floor. Staring at his visible face, the passengers look at him. As the kid's eyes open and his gloved hands touch his face, a worried look is shown as he realizes he is without a mask. He sits up as a passenger crouches down, looks around, and two boys step forward. His hand stretched out with Spider-Man's mask, the younger one steps forward, which Peter takes. Gazing at the boys through tear-filled eyes, Peter lowers his head, then slips on the mask to become Spider-Man again. Sitting up straight, he struggles to rise, and help is given to his feet by more hands that steady him. The door behind Spider-Man is clattered in as Octavius climbs on board, facing him. A passenger steps forward, followed by others who step between Spider-Man and Octavius. A smile is simply given by Octavius as he sweeps them aside using two of his limbs, leaving a clear path to Spider-Man. To those around him, Spider-Man gestures and staggers forward, but he is sent to the floor by a punch from a mechanical limb, where he lies helpless. Meanwhile, an electric storm hovers over the Osborn home, and inside, Harry drinks. Octavius is turned to see him holding Spider-Man above his head. A point is made by Harry to the couch, where Spider-Man had been seen by him standing over his dead father, and the bound figure is laid down by Octavius.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Spider-Man attaches webs to buildings flanking the track, but they break, causing him to fall. As the train rushes toward the river, he fires webs at buildings, enduring costume tears to slow the train. His face contorts as webs fail, and the train crashes through buffers, its first carriage teetering over. Spider-Man clings to the front, halting the train, closes his eyes, releases the web, and slumps forward. Passengers catch him, lifting the unconscious, unmasked Spider-Man into the carriage, where he is passed overhead and gently laid down. His face exposed, passengers stare. A boy returns Spider-Man's mask, which Peter gratefully accepts, tearfully dons, and becomes Spider-Man again. He sits up, aided by passengers. The door clatters open as Octavius boards, facing Spider-Man. Passengers shield Spider-Man, but Octavius effortlessly clears a path. Spider-Man gestures for help, advances, but is struck down by a mechanical limb, lying helpless. Meanwhile, an electric storm brews over the Osborn home. Inside, Harry drinks, then sees Octavius holding Spider-Man. Harry gestures to the couch where Spider-Man had stood over his dead father, and Octavius sets the bound hero there.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Spider-Man attaches webs to buildings, but they break, causing him to fall. As the train speeds toward the river, he fires webs, restraining the train despite ripping his costume. The train crashes through buffers, teeters on the edge, and Spider-Man, glued to the front, holds strong. The train halts, and he collapses. Passengers lift the unconscious, unmasked Spider-Man inside. Realizing he's maskless, he sits up. A boy gives him the mask, and Spider-Man, tearfully thankful, puts it on. Octavius boards, facing Spider-Man. Passengers step forward but are brushed aside. Spider-Man is punched to the floor. Meanwhile, Harry sees Octavius holding Spider-Man and points to where he once stood over his dead father. Octavius lays Spider-Man down.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Spider-Man expertly attaches not one but two formidable webs onto the towering buildings situated on either side of the bustling track, creating a temporary but strong hold. However, to his dismay, the webbing unexpectedly fractures, resulting in his body being propelled forward with uncontrollable momentum. As the train speeds relentlessly toward the looming river, Spider-Man rapidly shoots additional webs at the surrounding architectural structures, and a substantial block of webbing bursts forth into the open air. Spider-Man valiantly takes on the strain and pressure, which, despite tearing his costume in numerous areas, enables him to utilize the formidable webs to effectively restrain the train's relentless forward movement. His facial features contort in determination as sections of the webs begin to snap under the immense stress involved. The train approaches the final buffers with escalating speed, crashing through them and continuing its journey until it teeters precariously at the very edge, with the lead carriage dangerously overhanging. Spider-Man remains steadfastly adhered to the front, heroically holding the strong webs that remain attached to the buildings. The train miraculously grinds to a complete halt, and in a moment of exhaustion, Spider-Man's eyes gently close as he releases the webs and falls forward, spent. Numerous hands reach out to prevent him from tumbling, and the relieved passengers carefully lift the unconscious, unmasked Spider-Man into the relative safety of the carriage interior. His head hangs back, and as he's passed along, he is delicately lowered to the floor. With his face now revealed, the passengers gaze at him with a mix of shock and awe. When the kid's eyes flutter open and his gloved hands move to touch his face, a look of concern emerges as he realizes his mask is missing. He quickly sits up, prompting a nearby passenger to crouch down to his level, cautiously scanning the area, as two young boys step forward. The younger boy shyly extends his hand, offering Spider-Man's mask, which Peter gratefully accepts. Through eyes brimming with unshed tears, Peter looks appreciatively at the boys before bowing his head modestly and slipping on the familiar mask, embracing his identity as Spider-Man once more. He straightens up, fights to stand, and is aided to his feet by supportive hands that steady him. Suddenly, the door clatters open with a loud bang as Octavius boldly climbs aboard, confronting him. A brave passenger steps forward, soon followed by others who courageously position themselves between Spider-Man and the formidable Octavius. Octavius merely smiles, unfazed, and effortlessly sweeps them aside using two of his powerful mechanical limbs, leaving an unobstructed path to Spider-Man. Spider-Man makes a small gesture to those surrounding him and stumbles forward, but before he can regain full composure, a punch from a mechanical limb violently sends him crashing to the floor, where he lies helplessly. Meanwhile, back at the Osborn residence, an ominous electric storm gathers above, while inside, Harry drinks in solitude. He turns suddenly to notice Octavius ominously holding Spider-Man aloft by his head. Harry gestures toward the couch, the very spot where he had once observed Spider-Man standing over his deceased father, and in response, Octavius lays the bound and vulnerable figure down with deliberate care.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Spider-Man, demonstrating his impressive skill and agility, expertly affixes not just one but a pair of robust, formidable webs to the towering buildings that are situated on either side of the bustling, energetic track. This creates a temporary, yet remarkably strong hold. However, much to his dismay and frustration, the webbing unexpectedly fractures and snaps, resulting in his body being propelled forward with a force of uncontrollable momentum. As the train races relentless toward the looming, unavoidable river, Spider-Man quickly shoots a series of additional webs at the various surrounding architectural structures. A substantial block of webbing dramatically bursts forth into the open air as Spider-Man bravely faces the strain and pressure. Despite this effort tearing his iconic costume in numerous areas, he is able to utilize the strength of the formidable webs to successfully restrain the train's relentless forward movement. His facial features contort with determination as sections of the webs begin to snap under the immense stress involved. The train approaches the final buffers with escalating speed, crashing through them and continuing its perilous journey until it teeters precariously at the very edge, with the lead carriage dangerously overhanging the brink. Spider-Man remains steadfastly adhered to the front, heroically holding onto the strong webs that remain attached to the towering buildings. Miraculously, the train grinds to a complete and abrupt halt, and in a moment filled with sheer exhaustion, Spider-Man's eyes gently close as he releases the webs and falls forward, utterly spent. Numerous hands reach out to prevent him from tumbling, and the relieved passengers carefully lift the unconscious, now unmasked Spider-Man into the relative safety of the carriage interior. As his head hangs back, and he is passed along, he is delicately lowered to the floor. With his face now revealed, the passengers gaze at him with a startling mix of shock and awe. When the young hero's eyes flutter open and his gloved hands instinctively move to touch his face, a look of concern emerges as he realizes his mask is missing. He quickly sits up, prompting a nearby passenger to crouch down to his level, cautiously scanning the surrounding area, as two young boys step forward with intent. The younger boy shyly extends his hand, offering Spider-Man his mask, which Peter gratefully accepts with appreciation. Through eyes brimming with unshed tears of gratitude, Peter looks appreciatively at the boys before bowing his head modestly and slipping on the familiar mask, once again embracing his identity as Spider-Man. He straightens up, fights to stand, and is aided to his feet by supportive hands that steady him gently. Suddenly, the door clatters open with a loud, thunderous bang as Octavius boldly climbs aboard, confronting him menacingly. A brave passenger steps forward, soon followed by others who courageously position themselves between Spider-Man and the formidable Octavius. Octavius merely smiles, appearing completely unfazed, and effortlessly sweeps them aside using two of his powerful, mechanical limbs, leaving an unobstructed path to Spider-Man. With a small gesture to those surrounding him, Spider-Man stumbles forward, but before he can regain full composure, a brutal punch from a mechanical limb violently sends him crashing to the floor, where he lies helplessly. Meanwhile, back at the Osborn residence, an ominous and foreboding electric storm gathers and swirls above, while inside, Harry is drinking in solitude. He suddenly turns to notice Octavius ominously holding Spider-Man aloft by his head. Harry, with a gesture, directs him toward the couch, the very spot where he had once observed Spider-Man standing solemnly over his deceased father. In response, Octavius lays the bound and vulnerable figure down with deliberate care and intention.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Swinging into action, Spider-Man skillfully attaches two strands of his webbing to the towering buildings flanking each side of the track. However, the web unexpectedly snaps under the pressure, causing him to lurch forward precariously. With the train relentlessly speeding towards the river, Spider-Man quickly responds by firing additional webs at the surrounding buildings, each line shooting out with precision. Determined, he braces himself against the intense pull, his costume tearing at various points under the strain, yet he persists in his mission to halt the train's momentum. His face twists with effort as some of the webs begin to give way. The moment intensifies as the train barrels towards the buffers, crashes through them with a deafening force, and skids dangerously close to the edge, leaving the first carriage precariously dangling over it. He remains steadfastly positioned at the train's front, hands firmly gripping the webs tethered to the buildings. Finally, the train comes to a screeching stop. Exhausted, Spider-Man lets his eyes close, releases the web with a slackening grip, and slumps forward as fatigue overtakes him. An array of hands reaches out to catch him, preventing his fall, and the passengers carefully lift the unconscious, unmasked hero inside the carriage. Passing him gently above their heads, his head droops back until they lower him softly onto the floor, where his unmasked face is revealed, prompting the passengers to gaze at him in silent awe. As his lids slowly lift, Spider-Man's gloved hands instinctively touch his now-exposed face, and a look of concern crosses his features upon realizing his mask is missing. He gradually sits up as a concerned passenger kneels beside him, scanning the crowd, and then two boys approach. The younger boy extends his hand, offering the missing mask to Spider-Man, who accepts it. Peter, eyes brimming with emotion, looks gratefully at the boys before tilting his head downward and slipping the mask back on, resuming his Spider-Man persona. Regaining his composure, he sits upright and strains to stand, aided by a supportive cluster of hands that steady him. Just then, the door behind him clatters noisily as Octavius clambers aboard, confronting him directly. A passenger boldly steps forward, followed by several others who interpose themselves between Spider-Man and the advancing Octavius. Unfazed, Octavius grins and effortlessly brushes them aside with two of his mechanical limbs, clearing his path to Spider-Man. Taking a moment, Spider-Man gestures for the surrounding people to move to safety, then advances hesitantly. However, a swift strike from one of Octavius's mechanical limbs sends Spider-Man sprawling to the floor, leaving him vulnerable. Meanwhile, an ominous electric storm brews over the Osborn residence, where inside, Harry drinks alone. Turning, he is startled to see Octavius, who has lifted Spider-Man high above his head as though displaying a trophy. Harry points to the couch, a place seared in his memory where he had once seen Spider-Man stand over his deceased father, and Octavius obediently lays the subdued figure down upon it.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Spider-Man attempts to stop a speeding train by attaching webs to buildings on either side, but the strain causes the webs to break, and he falls forward. As the train nears the river, Spider-Man fires more webs that strain against the train's momentum, ripping his costume and contorting his features. Despite the webs breaking, they slow the train just before it reaches the edge, leaving the first carriage teetering. Spider-Man remains glued to the front, and as the train halts, he releases the webs and collapses. Passengers catch him, lifting the unconscious, unmasked Spider-Man and passing him over their heads until he is gently laid on the floor. Realizing he's unmasked, a worried Peter Parker sees his mask in a young boy's outstretched hand, accepts it with tear-filled eyes, and dons the mask to become Spider-Man again. Struggling to stand, he's aided by the passengers. As Octavius enters the carriage, passengers attempt to protect Spider-Man, but Octavius effortlessly pushes them aside. Spider-Man gestures for them to move back, but is punched to the floor by Octavius, lying helpless. Meanwhile, an electric storm brews over the Osborn home, where Harry drinks, witnessing Octavius bringing the captured Spider-Man inside and laying him on the couch where Harry had seen him stand over his father's body.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Spider-Man, the iconic superhero known for his agility and quick-thinking, attaches two webs to buildings on either side of the track, a method often used by him to control speed and direction, but the web breaks, causing him to fall forward dramatically. As the train hurtles towards the river, threatening a disastrous plunge into the water below, Spider-Man fires webs at buildings, utilizing the strong architectural structures to stop the speeding train, and a block of web shoots out. Spider-Man takes the strain, showcasing his superhuman strength, and although it rips his costume, which is designed to be both flexible and durable, in several places, he uses the webs to restrain the train's forward thrust. His features are contorted with the effort, as some of the webs, created from a special fluid that solidifies into a strong fibrous material, start to break. The train approaches the buffers, barriers placed to prevent accidental overruns, crashes through them, and careens forward to the edge, with the first carriage teetering over the precipice. Spider-Man stands glued to the front, holding the webs attached to the buildings. The train grinds to a halt, and Spider-Man's eyes close in exhaustion as he releases the web and slumps forward in a moment of vulnerability. Hands prevent him from falling, and the passengers, grateful for their lives, lift the unconscious, unmasked Spider-Man into the carriage. His head falls back as he's passed along over people's heads, a gesture of respect and admiration, until he's gently lowered to the floor. His face visible, a rare sight since Spider-Man's identity is a closely guarded secret, the passengers stare at him. As the kid's eyes open and his gloved hands touch his face, a worried look shows as he realizes he is without a mask. He sits up as a passenger crouches down, looks around, and two boys step forward. The younger one stretches out his hand with Spider-Man's mask, a symbol of his superhero persona, which Peter takes. Through tear-filled eyes, Peter gazes at the boys, reminded of the innocence and hope he fights to protect, then lowers his head, and slips on the mask to become Spider-Man again. He sits up straight, struggles to rise, and is helped to his feet by more hands that steady him, a community act of solidarity. The door behind Spider-Man clatters in as Octavius, also known as Doctor Octopus, a formidable enemy equipped with mechanical tentacles, climbs on board, facing him. A passenger steps forward, emboldened by Spider-Man's presence, followed by others who step between Spider-Man and Octavius. Octavius simply smiles and sweeps them aside using two of his powerful, metal limbs, leaving a clear path to Spider-Man. Spider-Man gestures to those around him and staggers forward, but a punch from a mechanical limb, one of Octavius's signature moves, sends him to the floor, where he lies helpless. Meanwhile, an electric storm, a sign of impending danger or change, hovers over the Osborn home, known for its secrets and troubled history, and inside, Harry drinks, consumed by his own demons. He turns to see Octavius holding Spider-Man above his head, symbolizing the dramatic power struggle between hero and villain. Harry points to the couch, where he had seen Spider-Man stand over his dead father, a moment that haunts him, and Octavius lays the bound figure down, setting the stage for the next confrontation.

His head falls back as he is passed along over people's heads until he is gently lowered to the floor. His face visible. the passengers stare at him. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. SpiderMan gestures to those around him and staggers forward but a punch from a mechanical limb sends him to the floor where he lies helpless. Meanwhile an electric storm hovers over the Osborn home and inside Harry drinks. He turns to see Octavius holding SpiderMan above his head. Harry points to the couch where he had seen SpiderMan stand over his dead father and Octavius lays the bound figure down.

test_cases.description: SpiderMan attaches two webs to buildings on either side of the track but the web breaks causing him to fall forward. As the train hurtles towards the river SpiderMan fires webs at buildings and a block of web shoots out. Meanwhile an electric storm hovers over the Osborn home and inside Harry drinks. He turns to see Octavius holding SpiderMan above his head. Harry points to the couch where he had seen SpiderMan stand over his dead father and Octavius lays the bound figure down.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The tortoise attaches two ropes to trees on either side of the river, but the rope snaps, causing it to tumble backward. As the bicycle speeds towards the canyon, the tortoise throws ropes at trees, and a bundle of rope flies out. The tortoise endures the tension, and although it tears its shell in several spots, it uses the ropes to halt the bicycle's backward drift. Its eyes are scrunched as some of the ropes begin to snap. The bicycle nears the gate, smashes through them, and rolls backward to the cliff, with the last wheel swaying over. The tortoise stands glued to the back, gripping the ropes attached to the trees. The bicycle screeches to a stop, and the tortoise's eyes shut as it releases the rope and leans backward. Wings stop it from dropping, and the crew lifts the sleeping, unmasked tortoise into the barge. Its head droops as it’s passed along over wings until it’s softly set down on the ground. Its shell visible, the crew gawks at it. As the cat's eyes open and its furry paws touch its shell, a puzzled expression shows as it notices it is without a shell. It stands up as a crew member leans down, glances around, and two kittens step closer. The smaller one reaches out its paw with the tortoise's shell, which Tim accepts. Through misty eyes, Tim looks at the kittens, then lowers its head and slips on the shell to become the tortoise once more. It stands up tall, struggles to rise, and is assisted to its feet by more wings that brace it. The hatch behind the tortoise swings in as Gordon sails on board, confronting it. A crew member strides forward, followed by others who stand between the tortoise and Gordon. Gordon merely grins and nudges them aside using two of his sails, leaving an open route to the tortoise. The tortoise signals to those near it and shuffles forward, but a jab from a wooden sail sends it to the ground, where it lies immobilized. Meanwhile, a lightning shower lingers over the Johnson cabin, and inside, Mark sips. He turns to see Gordon hoisting the tortoise above his sails. Mark gestures to the sofa, where he had seen the tortoise hover over his silent uncle, and Gordon places the wrapped creature down.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Spider-Man attempts to stop a runaway train by attaching webs to nearby buildings, but they break, causing him to fall. He fires more webs to restrain the train, despite it tearing his costume. As the train crashes through the buffers and teeters on the edge, Spider-Man clings to the front, managing to halt it. Exhausted, he slumps forward, and passengers lift him inside, discovering his unmasked identity. A young boy hands him his mask, which Peter gratefully accepts before donning it again. As he sits up, passengers help him to his feet. Octavius then boards, and passengers attempt to protect Spider-Man, but Octavius easily sweeps them aside and knocks Spider-Man down with his mechanical limb. Meanwhile, an electric storm looms over the Osborn home, where Harry sees Octavius with Spider-Man and directs him to place the bound hero on the couch, recalling Spider-Man standing over his dead father.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: Harry points to the couch where he had seen SpiderMan stand over his dead father and Octavius lays the bound figure down He turns to see Octavius holding SpiderMan above his head Meanwhile an electric storm hovers over the Osborn home and inside Harry drinks SpiderMan gestures to those around him and staggers forward but a punch from a mechanical limb sends him to the floor where he lies helpless Octavius simply smiles and sweeps them aside using two of his limbs leaving a clear path to SpiderMan A passenger steps forward followed by others who step between SpiderMan and Octavius The door behind SpiderMan clatters in as Octavius climbs on board facing him He sits up straight struggles to rise and is helped to his feet by more hands that steady him Through tearfilled eyes Peter gazes at the boys then lowers his head and slips on the mask to become SpiderMan again The younger one stretches out his hand with SpiderMan's mask which Peter takes He sits up as a passenger crouches down looks around and two boys step forward As the kid's eyes open and his gloved hands touch his face a worried look shows as he realizes he is without a mask the passengers stare at him His face visible His head falls back as he is passed along over people's heads until he is gently lowered to the floor Hands prevent him from falling and the passengers lift the unconscious unmasked SpiderMan into the carriage The train grinds to a halt and SpiderMan's eyes close as he releases the web and slumps forward SpiderMan stands glued to the front holding the webs attached to the buildings The train approaches the buffers crashes through them and careens forward to the edge with the first carriage teetering over His features are contorted as some of the webs start to break SpiderMan takes the strain and although it rips his costume in several places he uses the webs to restrain the train's forward thrust As the train hurtles towards the river SpiderMan fires webs at buildings and a block of web shoots out SpiderMan attaches two webs to buildings on either side of the track but the web breaks causing him to fall forward
